clusterName.description:
The name of the Cluster API cluster
if not given, the release name is used
clusterName.title: clusterName

calico.description:
Settings for the calico CNI
See https://projectcalico.docs.tigera.io/getting-started/kubernetes/helm
calico.title: calico

cilium.description:
Settings for the Cilium CNI
See https://docs.cilium.io/en/stable/gettingstarted/k8s-install-helm/ for details
cilium.title: cilium

enabled.description: Indicates if a CNI should be deployed
enabled.title: enabled

type.description: The CNI to deploy - supported values are calico or cilium
type.title: type

enabled.description:
Included for schema validation purposes
Has no effect unless this chart is used
as a dependency of the openstack-cluster
chart.
enabled.title: enabled

enabled.description: Indicates if the etcd defragmentation job should be enabled
enabled.title: enabled

namespace.description: This should be namespace in which the etcd pods are deployed
namespace.title: namespace

global.description: Global values are values that can be accessed from any chart or subchart by exactly the same name.
global.title: global

enabled.description: Indicates if ingress controllers should be enabled
enabled.title: enabled

nginx.description:
Settings for the Nginx ingress controller
https://github.com/kubernetes/ingress-nginx/tree/main/charts/ingress-nginx#configuration

enabled.description:
Indicates if the Nginx ingress controller should be enabled
The Nginx ingress controller is enabled by default if ingress controllers are enabled
enabled.title: enabled

nginx.title: nginx

xpuManagerMonitoring.description:
xpuManagerMonitoring requires Flux CD source
and kustomization controllers to be installed
on the CAPI management cluster.
xpuManagerMonitoring.title: xpuManagerMonitoring

enabled.description: Indicates if the Kubernetes dashboard should be enabled
enabled.title: enabled

mellanoxNetworkOperator.description: Settings for the Mellanox network operator

enabled.description:
Indicates if the network operator should be enabled
Note that because it uses node feature discovery to run only on nodes
with a Mellanox NIC available, the overhead of enabling this on clusters
that do not need it now but may need it in the future is low
enabled.title: enabled

mellanoxNetworkOperator.title: mellanoxNetworkOperator

enabled.description: Indicates if the metrics server should be deployed
enabled.title: enabled

enabled.description: Indicates if the cluster monitoring should be enabled
enabled.title: enabled

kubePrometheusStack.description:
Config for the kube-prometheus-stack helm chart
https://github.com/prometheus-community/helm-charts/blob/main/charts/kube-prometheus-stack

alertmanager.description: Enable persistence by default for prometheus and alertmanager

retention.description: By default, retain 7 days of data
retention.title: retention

alertmanager.title: alertmanager

retention.description:
The amount of data that is retained will be 90 days or 95% of the size of the
persistent volume, whichever is reached first
retention.title: retention

kubePrometheusStack.title: kubePrometheusStack

config.description: Enable retention and configure a default retention period of 31 days
config.title: config

enabled.description: Indicates if node feature discovery should be enabled
enabled.title: enabled

nodeProblemDetector.description: Settings for the node problem detector

enabled.description: Indicates if the node problem detector should be enabled
enabled.title: enabled

nodeProblemDetector.title: nodeProblemDetector

nvidiaGPUOperator.description: Settings for the NVIDIA GPU operator

enabled.description:
Indicates if the NVIDIA GPU operator should be enabled
Note that because it uses node feature discovery to run only on nodes
with an NVIDIA GPU available, the overhead of enabling this on clusters
that do not need it now but may need it in the future is low
enabled.title: enabled

nvidiaGPUOperator.title: nvidiaGPUOperator

ccm.description: Settings for the Cloud Controller Manager (CCM)

enabled.description:
Indicates if the OpenStack CCM should be enabled
By default, the CCM is enabled if the OpenStack integrations are enabled
See https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-openstack/blob/master/charts/openstack-cloud-controller-manager/values.yaml
enabled.title: enabled

ccm.title: ccm

cloudConfig.description:
cloud-config options for the OpenStack integrations
The [Global] section is configured to use the target cloud
See https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-openstack/blob/master/docs/openstack-cloud-controller-manager/using-openstack-cloud-controller-manager.md#config-openstack-cloud-controller-manager
and https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-openstack/blob/master/docs/cinder-csi-plugin/using-cinder-csi-plugin.md#block-storage

BlockStorage.description: By default, ignore volume AZs for Cinder as most clouds have a single globally-attachable Cinder AZ
BlockStorage.title: BlockStorage

cloudConfig.title: cloudConfig

csiCinder.description: Settings for the Cinder CSI plugin

additionalStorageClasses.description:
Additional storage classes to create for the Cinder CSI
For each item, the properties from the default storage class are supported (except enabled and isClusterDefault)
additionalStorageClasses.title: additionalStorageClasses

defaultStorageClass.description: Definition of the default storage class for Cinder CSI

allowVolumeExpansion.description: Indicates if volume expansion is allowed
allowVolumeExpansion.title: allowVolumeExpansion

allowedTopologies.description: The allowed topologies for the storage class
allowedTopologies.title: allowedTopologies

availabilityZone.description: The Cinder availability zone to use for volumes provisioned by the storage class
availabilityZone.title: availabilityZone

enabled.description: Indicates if the storage class should be enabled
enabled.title: enabled

fstype.description:
Filesystem type to use for volumes provisioned with the storage class
If not given, the default filesystem type will be used
fstype.title: fstype

isClusterDefault.description: Indicates if the Cinder default storage class is the cluster default storage class
isClusterDefault.title: isClusterDefault

name.description: The name of the storage class
name.title: name

reclaimPolicy.description: The reclaim policy for the storage class
reclaimPolicy.title: reclaimPolicy

volumeBindingMode.description: Controls when volume binding and dynamic provisioning should occur
volumeBindingMode.title: volumeBindingMode

volumeType.description:
The Cinder volume type to use for volumes provisioned by the storage class
If not given, the default volume type will be used
volumeType.title: volumeType

defaultStorageClass.title: defaultStorageClass

enabled.description:
Indicates if the Cinder CSI should be enabled
By default, it is enabled if the OpenStack integrations are enabled
See https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-openstack/blob/master/charts/cinder-csi-plugin/values.yaml
enabled.title: enabled

csiCinder.title: csiCinder

csiManila.description: Settings for the Manila CSI plugin

additionalStorageClasses.description:
Additional storage classes to create for the Manila CSI
For each item, the properties from the default storage class are supported (except for "enabled")
additionalStorageClasses.title: additionalStorageClasses

defaultStorageClass.description: Definition of the default storage class for the Manila CSI

allowVolumeExpansion.description: Indicates if volume expansion is allowed
allowVolumeExpansion.title: allowVolumeExpansion

allowedTopologies.description: The allowed topologies for the storage class
allowedTopologies.title: allowedTopologies

enabled.description: Indicates if the storage class should be enabled
enabled.title: enabled

isClusterDefault.description: Indicates if the Manila default storage class is the cluster default storage class
isClusterDefault.title: isClusterDefault

name.description: The name of the storage class
name.title: name

parameters.description:
The parameters for the storage class
See https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-openstack/blob/master/docs/manila-csi-plugin/using-manila-csi-plugin.md#controller-service-volume-parameters

type.description:
The Manila share type to use
If not given and the Ceph CSI plugin is installed, cephfs is used
type.title: type

parameters.title: parameters

provisioner.description:
The provisioner for the storage class
If not given and the Ceph CSI plugin is installed, cephfs.manila.csi.openstack.org is used
provisioner.title: provisioner

reclaimPolicy.description: The reclaim policy for the storage class
reclaimPolicy.title: reclaimPolicy

volumeBindingMode.description: Controls when volume binding and dynamic provisioning should occur
volumeBindingMode.title: volumeBindingMode

defaultStorageClass.title: defaultStorageClass

enabled.description:
Indicates if the Manila CSI should be enabled
By default, it is disabled as Manila is not commonly available
See https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-openstack/blob/master/charts/manila-csi-plugin/values.yaml
enabled.title: enabled

csiManila.title: csiManila

enabled.description: Indicates if the OpenStack integrations should be enabled
enabled.title: enabled

targetNamespace.description: The target namespace for the OpenStack integrations
targetNamespace.title: targetNamespace

reloader.description: Setting for Reloader used to restart workloads on Secret/ConfigMap changes

enabled.description: Indicates if Reloader should be enabled
enabled.title: enabled

namespace.description: Deploy to the same namespace as OpenStack services
namespace.title: namespace

reloader.title: reloader
